comments:
Create an EAR.
Create a web project.
Now add that web to the EAR on the EAR's j2ee modules property sheet.
Then delete the Web project.

The J2EEProjectDeleteJob never finishes which blocks other jobs from starting.
This may be related to some deadlock "fixes" we were looking at, haven't had a chance to debug yet...
haven't seen this problem myself - will investigate...
Make sure you have the latest WTP 1.5.1 build.

hmmm, definitely something in a recent build (your thought about the recent deadlock fixes is probably right).

Just updated my build to 200607201712 and I'm hitting a hang before I can even attempt to delete the project. I'm going to update the bug to reflect the broader scope. John, I'm going to send back your way since you're more familiar with the deadlock fixes that were just put in but I'll keep investigating.

First, I get these (note: don't get these from the build just from my sync from HEAD version)

We already have defects for the module dependency hang:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=151283
Just checked in the fix for the hange (bug 151283)  That may have fixed this as well.  I'll give it a try.
yup that seems to have fixed it.  Please mark this as a duplicate of 151283
